alert.note: Alert for Cedar; Clinton; Muscatine; Scott (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 24 at 10:05PM CDT until June 24 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: The National Weather Service in the Quad Cities has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Eastern Cedar County in east central Iowa... Scott County in east central Iowa... Northern Muscatine County in east central Iowa... Southern Clinton County in east central Iowa... * Until 1100 PM CDT. * At 1005 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Lowden to near Sunbury to near Muscatine County Fairgrounds, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Lowden, Bennett, Sunbury and Bennett Park around 1010 PM CDT. Durant, Wheatland, Stockton, New Liberty and Big Rock around 1015 PM CDT. Calamus, Dixon, Plainview, Camp Liberty and Sherman Park around 1020 PM CDT. Walcott, Grand Mound, Maysville and Sweetland Center around 1025 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Donahue, New Era, Wildcat Den State Park, Fairport Recreation Area, Davenport, Eldridge, DeWitt, Long Grove, Clinton County Fairgrounds, Pleasant Prairie, Davenport Municipal Airport, Midway Beach, Shady Creek Campground, Blue Grass, Montpelier, Clark`s Ferry Recreation Area, Park View, Scott County Park, Bettendorf, Riverdale, McCausland, Panorama Park, Malone and West Lake Park. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
